newsitem.title: ITALY: EIB expects to maintain heavy lira borrowing in 97.
newsitem.headline: EIB expects to maintain heavy lira borrowing in 97.

text.p: The European Investment Bank (EIB) expects to maintain or even increase its heavy flow of lira borrowing in 1997, EIB chairman Brian Unwin said on Tuesday.

Unwin told a news conference that the EIB operated in 22 different currencies but a quarter of total borrowing in 1996 had been in the Italian lira. This cash was used to help finance Italian projects worth some 7.94 trillion lire.
"Total borrowing to Italy (in 1997) will be the same amount as this year, or maybe even more," Unwin said.
He said that 40 percent of funding in Italy in 1996 went on energy projects, 20 percent on urban renewal and 25 percent on supporting small and medium-sized companies.
He expected more funding next year to be aimed at transport projects and at the small and medium-sized firms, especially in the south of Italy. -- Rome newsroom +396 6782501
